pages.text:
Contact or Visit Us
7116 85th Street Court East
Bradenton, FL 34202
(941) 739-9313
rv@lingerlodge.com
RV Park Office:
Monday – Sunday: 10 AM – 5 PM
Restaurant:
Tuesday - Sunday: 11:30 AM - 9 PM
Getting there
Heading South on I-75
take exit 217 East, turn left to go under the overpass. Take the first right after you go under the overpass, you are now on Ranch Lake Blvd.
Heading North on I-75
take exit 217A East, take the first right after you exit the ramp, you are now on Ranch Lake Blvd.
You will come to a stop sign, on your right is the Texas Roadhouse Steakhouse. Proceed through the stop sign. You will drive behind the Walmart shopping center. Turn left at the stop sign, you are still on Ranch Lake Blvd. Continue to the end of Ranch Lake Blvd. At the stop sign, take a left onto Linger Lodge Road. At the end of Linger Lodge Road turn right onto 85th Street Court East, drive approximately 2 blocks and enter our parking lot.
Do you have any questions for us?
FAQ:
Are you open for reservations?
Yes, you can reserve via
this link
.
Can I store my RV at the Linger Lodge?
No, but if you have stayed at the Linger Lodge RV Park in the past, you are eligible for one month free at the
Exit 170 RV Storage
if you book for a minimum of 6 months!
Currently, by sending a question through the form below, you will automatically be signed up to Linger Lodge's newsletter. Here we will keep you updated on special events, deals & other Linger Lodge news. You can opt-out at any time.

Thank you!

Linger Lodge RV Park & Restaurant
7116 85th Street Court East
Bradenton, FL 34202
Email:
rv@lingerlodge.com
Tel:
(941) 739-9313

restaurant@lingerlodge.com
Tel: (
941)-755-2757

Sign up to our Newsletter
We'll keep you updated on special events, deals & other Linger Lodge RV Park news.
Sign up
© 2024 by River Loft LLC      —      Design by
Sophinka Design

About Us
Linger Lodge is a classic Old Florida-style RV Park and restaurant in Bradenton, on the Northern bank of the Braden River.
The Lodge is known for its authentic Old Florida charm and cozy riverside atmosphere. Located right on the river, Linger Lodge is surrounded by nature, home to some beautifully authentic Floridan vistas and no shortage of alligators, turtles, and other wildlife.
RV Park
The Linger Lodge RV Park is a waterfront RV campground, home to 139 RV spaces for short- and long-term stays. You can stay with us for up to 6 months.
Many of the RV spaces are located in the shade of palm trees and live oak canopies, protected from the hot Florida sun.
The RV park aims to evoke peace and calm for a tranquil and relaxing vacation, as well as a real sense of community for those looking to stay here long term.
This sense of community and tranquility makes for a perfect destination for both families and retirees looking for a unique experience or just to relax in a quintessentially Floridian natural environment.
Learn more about our Amenities
Restaurant
The Linger Lodge Restaurant & Bar is a quirky yet charming restaurant with a scenic view of the Braden River.
A family favorite, it serves classic Southern U.S. cuisine.
The restaurant’s walls are adorned with a range of taxidermied creatures, including some fictional creations from the Lodge’s previous owner, like the Jackalope, the Alaskan Fur Fish and the Walking Catfish. The unique taxidermied decor has turned the restaurant into a popular destination for tourists and locals alike.
The restaurant serves everything you’d expect from a classic Southern diner and more, from burgers and sandwiches to barbecued meats and fried seafood. Their more unusual dishes include fried “alligator bites” and fresh frog legs. The bar sports unique cocktails like the “Linger Lizard”, “Swamp Water”, and the “River Otter”.  A favourite among the guests is the special Linger Lodge Bloody Mary.
Learn more about the Restaurant
Need a place to leave your RV?
If you have stayed at the Linger Lodge RV Park in the past, you are eligible for one month free at the Exit 170 RV storage *
*if you book for a minimum of 6 months
Learn more about Secure RV Storage
Gallery Masonry
